# Homework 8-B Kung Fu Winner [100 points] (3 solves)
```python
from sympy.ntheory.modular import crt
import owiener
from gmpy2 import *
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes

n = 
e = 
c = 
c1s =  [, , ]
n1s =  [, , ]

s = iroot(crt(n1s, c1s)[0], 3)[0]
new_e = e * s
c_prime = pow(c, s, n)
d = owiener.attack(new_e,n)
m = long_to_bytes(pow(c_prime, d, n)).decode()
print(m)
```
Chinese Reminder Theorem to get the s.

Then, raise both side of to power s: $(m^e)^s=c^s~(mod~n)->m^(e*s)=c^s~(mod~n)$, and now we have a new public exponent and new ciphertext.
Lastly, when d is relatively small with known e and N, wiener's attack is involved.



Reference:
- [Chinese Remainder Theorem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_remainder_theorem)
- [Wiener's Attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiener%27s_attack)
